Head, Wrightson & Co., Ltd."], "organisations/institutions": [], "dates": ["1924"], "places": [], "descriptions": ["This model represents a charging apparatus suitable for furnaces with large outputs. A uniform distribution of the charge and reduction of labour are secured by the use of a mechanical charger of this type. The apparatus consists of an inclined girder tramway on which are two lines of rails, so that the weight of the ascending skip is balanced by that of the descending skip on the other line. These skips carry about 2 tons of ore, and are made of strong sheet-iron. They run on four flanged wheels, of which the two in front are half the thickness of those at the rear. A special guide rail is provided at the top of the furnace, placed so that the narrower front wheels, when descending, pass by it, while the broader hind wheels mount upon the guide, with the result that the back of the skip is lifted up and the charge in the skip is shot into the upper hopper, provided with a small cup and cone. When sufficient material has accumulated in this hopper, the weight of the charge causes the cone to fall, allowing the charge to fall into a gas chamber, which in its turn is also provided with cup and cone discharge of normal dimensions, fitted with a balance weight. A further accumulation of charge in this chamber causes the balance weight to rise, allowing the charge to fall into the furnace. By this means an even distribution of charge in the furnace is obtained, while the loss of gas is reduced to a minimum. The hoist is electrically operated, and is under the entire control of one man."], "other": ["Scale 1 : 24.", "Inv. 1924-790", "S.M. 2318"]}
